trans-unit.source: Create a PHP-MySQL web app in Azure App Service and deploy using Git
trans-unit.target: Create a PHP-MySQL web app in Azure App Service and deploy using Git

trans-unit.source: A tutorial that demonstrates how to create a PHP web app that stores data in MySQL and use Git deployment to Azure.
trans-unit.target: A tutorial that demonstrates how to create a PHP web app that stores data in MySQL and use Git deployment to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Create a PHP-MySQL web app in Azure App Service and deploy using Git
trans-unit.target: Create a PHP-MySQL web app in Azure App Service and deploy using Git

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to create a PHP-MySQL web app and how to deploy it to [App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) using Git.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to create a PHP-MySQL web app and how to deploy it to [App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) using Git.

trans-unit.source: You will use [PHP][install-php], the MySQL Command-Line Tool (part of [MySQL][install-mysql]), a web server, and [Git][install-git] installed on your computer.
trans-unit.target: You will use [PHP][install-php], the MySQL Command-Line Tool (part of [MySQL][install-mysql]), a web server, and [Git][install-git] installed on your computer.

trans-unit.source: The instructions in this tutorial can be followed on any operating system, including Windows, Mac, and Linux.
trans-unit.target: The instructions in this tutorial can be followed on any operating system, including Windows, Mac, and Linux.

trans-unit.source: Upon completing this guide, you will have a PHP/MySQL web app running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Upon completing this guide, you will have a PHP/MySQL web app running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You will learn:
trans-unit.target: You will learn:

trans-unit.source: How to create a web app and a MySQL database using the [Azure Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715).
trans-unit.target: How to create a web app and a MySQL database using the [Azure Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715).

trans-unit.source: Because PHP is enabled in [App Service Web Apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) by default, nothing special is required to run your PHP code.
trans-unit.target: Because PHP is enabled in [App Service Web Apps](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) by default, nothing special is required to run your PHP code.

trans-unit.source: How to publish and re-publish your application to Azure using Git.
trans-unit.target: How to publish and re-publish your application to Azure using Git.

trans-unit.source: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple registration web app in PHP.
trans-unit.target: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple registration web app in PHP.

trans-unit.source: The application will be hosted in Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: The application will be hosted in Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot of the completed application is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot of the completed application is below:

trans-unit.source: Azure PHP web site
trans-unit.target: Azure PHP web site

trans-unit.source: Set up the development environment
trans-unit.target: Set up the development environment

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes you have [PHP][install-php], the MySQL Command-Line Tool (part of [MySQL][install-mysql]), a web server, and [Git][install-git] installed on your computer.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes you have [PHP][install-php], the MySQL Command-Line Tool (part of [MySQL][install-mysql]), a web server, and [Git][install-git] installed on your computer.

trans-unit.source: If you are performing this tutorial on Windows, you can set up your machine for PHP and automatically configure IIS (the built-in web server in Windows) by installing the Azure SDK for PHP.
trans-unit.target: If you are performing this tutorial on Windows, you can set up your machine for PHP and automatically configure IIS (the built-in web server in Windows) by installing the Azure SDK for PHP.

trans-unit.source: Create a web app and set up Git publishing
trans-unit.target: Create a web app and set up Git publishing

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create a web app and a MySQL database:
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to create a web app and a MySQL database:

trans-unit.source: Login to the [Azure Portal][management-portal].
trans-unit.target: Login to the [Azure Portal][management-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click the **New** icon.
trans-unit.target: Click the **New** icon.

trans-unit.source: Click **Web + Mobile**, then **Azure Marketplace**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Web + Mobile**, then **Azure Marketplace**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Web Apps**, then **Web app + MySQL**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Web Apps**, then **Web app + MySQL**.

trans-unit.source: Then, click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Then, click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a valid name for your resource group.
trans-unit.target: Enter a valid name for your resource group.

trans-unit.source: Set resource group name
trans-unit.target: Set resource group name

trans-unit.source: Enter values for your new web app.
trans-unit.target: Enter values for your new web app.

trans-unit.source: Create web app
trans-unit.target: Create web app

trans-unit.source: Enter values for your new database, including agreeing to the legal terms.
trans-unit.target: Enter values for your new database, including agreeing to the legal terms.

trans-unit.source: Create new MySQL database
trans-unit.target: Create new MySQL database

trans-unit.source: When the web app has been created, you will see the new resource group.
trans-unit.target: When the web app has been created, you will see the new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of the web app to configure its settings.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of the web app to configure its settings.

trans-unit.source: Click **Set up continuous deployment**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Set up continuous deployment**.

trans-unit.source: Set up Git publishing
trans-unit.target: Set up Git publishing

trans-unit.source: Select **Local Git Repository** for the source.
trans-unit.target: Select **Local Git Repository** for the source.

trans-unit.source: Set up Git repository
trans-unit.target: Set up Git repository

trans-unit.source: To enable Git publishing, you must provide a user name and password.
trans-unit.target: To enable Git publishing, you must provide a user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the user name and password you create.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the user name and password you create.

trans-unit.source: (If you have set up a Git repository before, this step will be skipped.)
trans-unit.target: (If you have set up a Git repository before, this step will be skipped.)

trans-unit.source: Create publishing credentials
trans-unit.target: Create publishing credentials

trans-unit.source: Get remote MySQL connection information
trans-unit.target: Get remote MySQL connection information

trans-unit.source: To connect to the MySQL database that is running in Web Apps, your will need the connection information.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the MySQL database that is running in Web Apps, your will need the connection information.

trans-unit.source: To get MySQL connection information, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To get MySQL connection information, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: From your resource group, click the database:
trans-unit.target: From your resource group, click the database:

trans-unit.source: Select database
trans-unit.target: Select database

trans-unit.source: From the database sumamry, select **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: From the database sumamry, select **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: Select properties
trans-unit.target: Select properties

trans-unit.source: Make note of the values for `Database`, `Host`, `User Id`, and `Password`.
trans-unit.target: Make note of the values for `Database`, `Host`, `User Id`, and `Password`.

trans-unit.source: Note properties
trans-unit.target: Note properties

trans-unit.source: Build and test your app locally
trans-unit.target: Build and test your app locally

trans-unit.source: Now that you have created a web app, you can develop your application locally, then deploy it after testing.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have created a web app, you can develop your application locally, then deploy it after testing.

trans-unit.source: The Registration application is a simple PHP application that allows you to register for an event by providing your name and email address.
trans-unit.target: The Registration application is a simple PHP application that allows you to register for an event by providing your name and email address.

trans-unit.source: Information about previous registrants is displayed in a table.
trans-unit.target: Information about previous registrants is displayed in a table.

trans-unit.source: Registration information is stored in a MySQL database.
trans-unit.target: Registration information is stored in a MySQL database.

trans-unit.source: The application consists of one file (copy/paste code available below):
trans-unit.target: The application consists of one file (copy/paste code available below):

trans-unit.source: **index.php**: Displays a form for registration and a table containing registrant information.
trans-unit.target: **index.php**: Displays a form for registration and a table containing registrant information.

trans-unit.source: To build and run the application locally, follow the steps below.
trans-unit.target: To build and run the application locally, follow the steps below.

trans-unit.source: Note that these steps assume you have PHP, the MySQL Command-Line Tool (part of MySQL), and a web server set up on your local machine, and that you have enabled the [PDO extension for MySQL][pdo-mysql].
trans-unit.target: Note that these steps assume you have PHP, the MySQL Command-Line Tool (part of MySQL), and a web server set up on your local machine, and that you have enabled the [PDO extension for MySQL][pdo-mysql].

trans-unit.source: Connect to the remote MySQL server, using the value for `Data Source`, `User Id`, `Password`, and `Database` that you retrieved earlier:
trans-unit.target: Connect to the remote MySQL server, using the value for `Data Source`, `User Id`, `Password`, and `Database` that you retrieved earlier:

trans-unit.source: The MySQL command prompt will appear:
trans-unit.target: The MySQL command prompt will appear:

trans-unit.source: Paste in the following `CREATE TABLE` command to create the `registration_tbl` table in your database:
trans-unit.target: Paste in the following `CREATE TABLE` command to create the `registration_tbl` table in your database:

trans-unit.source: In your web server's root directory, create a folder called `registration` and create a file in it called `index.php`.
trans-unit.target: In your web server's root directory, create a folder called `registration` and create a file in it called `index.php`.

trans-unit.source: Open the **index.php** file in a text editor or IDE and add the following code, and complete the necessary changes marked with `//TODO:` comments.
trans-unit.target: Open the **index.php** file in a text editor or IDE and add the following code, and complete the necessary changes marked with `//TODO:` comments.

trans-unit.source: You can now browse to **http://localhost/registration/index.php** to test the application.
trans-unit.target: You can now browse to **http://localhost/registration/index.php** to test the application.

trans-unit.source: Publish your app
trans-unit.target: Publish your app

trans-unit.source: After you have tested your app locally, you can publish it to Web Apps using Git.
trans-unit.target: After you have tested your app locally, you can publish it to Web Apps using Git.

trans-unit.source: You will initialize your local Git repository and publish the application.
trans-unit.target: You will initialize your local Git repository and publish the application.

trans-unit.source: These are the same steps shown in the portal at the end of the Create a web app and Set up Git Publishing section above.
trans-unit.target: These are the same steps shown in the portal at the end of the Create a web app and Set up Git Publishing section above.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) If you've forgotten or misplaced your Git remote repostitory URL, navigate to the web app properties on the portal.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) If you've forgotten or misplaced your Git remote repostitory URL, navigate to the web app properties on the portal.

trans-unit.source: Open GitBash (or a terminal, if Git is in your `PATH`), change directories to the root directory of your application, and run the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Open GitBash (or a terminal, if Git is in your `PATH`), change directories to the root directory of your application, and run the following commands:

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted for the password you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted for the password you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Initial Push to Azure via Git
trans-unit.target: Initial Push to Azure via Git

trans-unit.source: Browse to **http://[site name].azurewebsites.net/index.php** to begin using the application (this information will be stored on your account dashboard):
trans-unit.target: Browse to **http://[site name].azurewebsites.net/index.php** to begin using the application (this information will be stored on your account dashboard):

trans-unit.source: Azure PHP web site
trans-unit.target: Azure PHP web site

trans-unit.source: After you have published your app, you can begin making changes to it and use Git to publish them.
trans-unit.target: After you have published your app, you can begin making changes to it and use Git to publish them.

trans-unit.source: Publish changes to your app
trans-unit.target: Publish changes to your app

trans-unit.source: To publish changes to your app, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To publish changes to your app, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Make changes to your app locally.
trans-unit.target: Make changes to your app locally.

trans-unit.source: Open GitBash (or a terminal, it Git is in your `PATH`), change directories to the root directory of your app, and run the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Open GitBash (or a terminal, it Git is in your `PATH`), change directories to the root directory of your app, and run the following commands:

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted for the password you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted for the password you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Pushing site changes to Azure via Git
trans-unit.target: Pushing site changes to Azure via Git

trans-unit.source: Browse to **http://[site name].azurewebsites.net/index.php** to see your app and any changes you may have made:
trans-unit.target: Browse to **http://[site name].azurewebsites.net/index.php** to see your app and any changes you may have made:

trans-unit.source: Azure PHP web site
trans-unit.target: Azure PHP web site

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)

trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)

trans-unit.target: test
